There's nothing wrong with the file. There's something wrong with your setup.
As rjamesbe and sa_nick have said, something with this file is a little off. While it plays fine via the PC, it will not convert via MKV2VOB, which has never been an issue before.

Wanted to help those having issues with this file regarding mkv2vob. Download a program called MKVtoolnix, which you can get with a quick search of Google. Add the Breaking Bad mkv and then select the video portion under the Tracks, chapters and tags heading, then go to the area under it with the labels General track options|Format specific options|Extra options and click the Extra options tab. Then click None under the compression tab. Repeat for the audio portion and click None again for compression and then click Start muxing. After it's all done, run it through mkv2vob again and you should be all set. Hope this helps.

Or instead of all that, install the K Lite codec pack, right click the file, select the Open With option, pick Media Player Classic, and enjoy.

having read the various comments here (and also the solution) ... to summarize:

- nothing wrong with the file (header removal compression is a mkv-container feature, unfortunately most standalone players don't support it and therefore won't play the file)
- solution: remux with mkvtoolnix/mmg (file --> options --> mmg --> check disable header removal compression for a/v tracks by default --> ok)

@ Tropius__B

Couldn't've written it better!

:lol:

ah and btw the current version of mediainfo tells you if header removal compression in an mkv is used or not: if there's the line "Muxing Mode: Header stripping" in any of the audio/video tracks it means that it's used and that you'll have to remux to make it standalone compatible. (or that you can use it in eg mkv2vob for ps3)
